question.text: After penetrating stigmatic and stylar tissue the pollen tube usually grows down towards the egg cell because:

options.text: It has no other passage to follow
It grows under the control of egg nucleus
The egg cell attracts the pollen tubes as they have dissimilar electric charge
The filiform apparatus of synergids are believed to attract the pollen tubes

solution.text: Embryo sac is made up of 7 cells. Three antipodal cells, one central cell, two synergids and one egg cell. Three antipodal cells are present at chalazal side which provide nutrition to rest other cells before fertilization whereas central cell after fertilization becomes endospermous and provide nutrition to the developing embryo while synergids possess filiform apparatus which attract the pollen tube and guide the tube towards egg cell  and burst the tube to release their both male gametes in embryosac for fertilization.
